context: <b5_0>Discrete transistors<b5_0/> are <a0_0>individually packaged transistors<a0_0/>. Transistors come in many different semiconductor packages (see image). The <b6_0>two<b6_0/> main categories are <a1_0><b7_0><b9_0>through-hole<b9_0/><b7_0/> (or leaded), and surface-mount<a1_0/>, also known as <a2_0>surface-mount device (SMD)<a2_0/>. The <a3_0>ball grid array (BGA)<a3_0/> is the latest surface-mount package (currently only for large integrated circuits). It has <a4_0>solder "balls" on the underside in place of leads<a4_0/>. Because they are smaller and have shorter interconnections, SMDs have better high-frequency characteristics but lower <b8_0>power rating<b8_0/>.
